data.body:
Introduce a lightweight coverage regression mechanism that warns (not blocks) when coverage drops. Approach:
1. Add a coverage threshold check to the existing CI workflow or coverage.yml
2. Compare current coverage against a baseline stored in the repo (e.g. coverage-baseline.json)
3. On regression: post a warning comment on the PR or annotate the workflow summary — do NOT fail the build
4. On improvement: auto-update the baseline
5. Add a simple script (e.g. scripts/check-coverage.mjs) that:
   - Reads coverage-summary.json from vitest output
   - Compares against baseline
   - Exits 0 always (soft gate) but prints clear warnings if coverage dropped
   - Optionally uses GitHub Actions annotations (::warning::) for visibility
6. Store baseline as coverage-baseline.json in repo root (committed)

Keep it painless: no external services, no build failures, just visibility. The goal is awareness — developers see when they're regressing and can make informed decisions.
data.title: Add soft coverage regression gate to CI
